creator: George.Lindholm@ubc.ca
text:
Both testshmconsumer and testshmproducer fail with error 254.

A truss of the run shows:

14351:  open("data/apr.testshm.shm", O_RDONLY|O_LARGEFILE) Err#2 ENOENT
14351:  _exit(-2)

and no corresponding create of the shm file.

APR 1.0.1, Solaris 9, gcc 3.3.1
./configure --prefix=/share/util

   George

These aren't really useful parts of the general test suite, and are more for
developer testing.
creator: chip@force-elite.com

text:
Shouldn't these programs be included in the OTHER_PROGRAMS list instead then?
I think its reasonable that 'cd test && make check' should have a chance of 
succeeding. As it is now it doesn't and the testall program is never run.

--- test/Makefile.in.orig       Wed Oct  4 18:47:25 2006
+++ test/Makefile.in    Wed Oct  4 18:47:54 2006
@@ -12,12 +12,13 @@ VPATH = @srcdir@

 STDTEST_PORTABLE = \
        testlockperf@EXEEXT@ \
-       testshmproducer@EXEEXT@ \
-       testshmconsumer@EXEEXT@ \
        testmutexscope@EXEEXT@ \
        testall@EXEEXT@

-OTHER_PROGRAMS = sendfile@EXEEXT@
+OTHER_PROGRAMS = \
+       sendfile@EXEEXT@ \
+       testshmproducer@EXEEXT@ \
+       testshmconsumer@EXEEXT@

 PROGRAMS = $(STDTEST_PORTABLE) $(STDTEST_NONPORTABLE) $(OTHER_PROGRAMS)
creator: kurt@intricatesoftware.com

text:
I just lost half a day's work trying to figure out why the tests were failing. 
I would *really* appreciate it if y'all could fix this.
creator: dbergstr@juniper.net
wrowe@apache.org
text: Thanks for the patch Kurt, looks sane to us.  Committed.
